descriptions.online: Encrypt your message and get a secure link to share.
descriptions.traditional: Encrypt your message locally, without sending it to any server. Only you have the encrypted code.
descriptions.message: Decrypt messages by entering the secret key and encrypted code or online link.

help.description: The system has two main modes: ONLINE, which allows you to generate an encrypted message and save it to share via a link, and TRADITIONAL, which offers an interface to encrypt text locally, without server storage. In both modes, it is necessary to use a key to decrypt information securely from the Message tab.
help.onlineSecurity: Messages in ONLINE mode are not stored in plain text. When you click the "Save" button, the browser first encrypts the data locally and then sends it to the server to generate the exchange link.
help.expiration: Additionally, this mode allows you to set an expiration time for the message and activate the option to destroy it when read. This way, the person who receives the link will only have one opportunity to access the message.
help.securityRecommendation: For greater security, it is recommended that the key be as long as possible, preferably a phrase.
help.sourceCode: The source code is available on GitHub.
